medical_history.chief_complaint: Onset of multiple sebaceous adenomas and carcinomas after kidney transplantation and immunosuppressive therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented 4 years post-kidney transplantation with several flesh-colored umbilicated papules on the face and scalp, which were biopsied and identified as sebaceous adenomas. A papule on the upper cutaneous lip was found to be a sebaceous adenoma with focal atypia, leading to excision. He has had more than 30 sebaceous adenomas, 8 sebaceous carcinomas, and 2 squamous cell carcinomas removed, suggesting ongoing progression and development of new lesions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hepatitis C and renal transplantation secondary to malignant hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Extensive family history of colon cancer, including the patient's father, one brother, three paternal uncles, and a paternal cousin. The father and uncles died from colon cancer.
